intro: Pseuduvaria clemensiae, commonly known as the Clemens's pseuduvaria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
